6/ Finally, all of this Brexit chaos is being imposed on Scotland against our will. To stop this ever happening again, we need to be independent - which is why the demand for #indyref2020 will be at heart of @theSNP campaign. ENDS

5/ For the argument for election in more detail, this is a good read. There are undoubtedly pros and cons but, assuming extension for Jan 31 secured, the case for acting now is strong. https://t.co/GngBN1D078

4/ To change the course Johnson is taking us on, we need to beat him. I accept that challenge for @theSNP in Scotland. Other parties have to do the same elsewhere in UK. Doing nothing almost guarantees he gets what he wants - Brexit delivered, possibly through ‚Äòno deal‚Äô.

3/ For all his bluster, Johnson would much prefer to fight an election with Brexit already ‚Äòdelivered‚Äô. An election now would instead force him to explain his failure to keep his 31 October ‚Äòdo or die‚Äô promise and also defend his bad deal.

2/ Re a People‚Äôs Vote, I‚Äôve strongly supported that and @theSNP would vote for it - but there‚Äôs no evidence that the majority for it exists within this Parliament. And if there is an extension to Jan 31, the clock starts ticking again immediately. We have no time to waste.

1/ A thread on our call for a general election. Firstly, we have to ask ourselves what the alternative is. Doing nothing allows Johnson to get his bad deal through (with Lab support) or, even worse, run down clock to end January when no deal becomes a real risk all over again

4. And I will continue to advance the preparations to give Scotland the right to choose our own future through independence, rather than having a future that we don‚Äôt want imposed on us by Boris Johnson and the Tories. That is now more important than ever.
3. Most immediately I, @scotgov and @theSNP will work with others to do everything we can to block his plan for a no deal Brexit - which would do catastrophic harm to Scotland.

2. However, it would be hypocritical not to be frank about the profound concerns I have at the prospect of his premiership. I am certain that the vast majority of people of Scotland would not have chosen to hand the keys of No 10 to someone with his views and track record.
